title: Seeley Lake Sasquatch Fat Bike Ride
description: Fat bike ride in Seeley Lake. Come check out the great groomed trails available in town.
course: A variety of trails throughout the Seeley Lake area. Courses include fully groomed wide trails as well as groomed single track. Riders can choose between a 10 mile and a 20 mile course.
registration:
Registration available Friday, March 4 from 6-9pm at Lindey's Prime Steakhouse.

Race day registration is available day of at SLE Outdoor on Saturday, March 5 from 8-9am.
notes: Event is permitted by the Lolo National Forest Seeley Lake Ranger District.
directions: Drive to Seeley Lake. SLE Outdoor is in the Bison and Bear Shopping court.

title: Montana Hell Ride
description: 85 and 52 mile options.  The Montana Hell Ride a 33 miles of dirt, the rest is pavement.  Start and finishes in the Big Flat Area of Missoula.  Overall time format for age groups.  Mass start event.
course: 85 and 52 mile options.  3867 feet of climbing on the 85 option.

address.street: Helena BLM Scratchgravels District, Echo Dr. TH

title: Herron Hammer XC Mountain Bike Race
course:
9 mile loops, single track and double track.
NEW COURSE THIS YEAR!
registration: Online Registration saves $5.00 Onsite registration available 7:30 to 9:00 AM in pavilion at top of hill
notes:
contact race director with any questions at thomasshelit@gmail.com
406-250-4211
directions: :  From Missoula area (south of Kalispell) turn left onto Rocky Cliff Road (coffee kiosk on the left, propane company on the right).  Turn left onto Airport Road (where Rocky Cliff Road ends).  Go about 2 miles to Herron Park.

title: Wednesday Night Race League #1 - Beginner
description: The first race of the Wednesday Night Race League. Head up to Marshall Mountain for a new course that utilizes some of the Marshall Mountain course, as well as rolling down to the rolling hills of Mount Jumbo.
course: Parking and staging at Marshall Mountain parking area. Course will incorporate lower portions of the Marshall Mountain race course, as well as dirt roads and trails on Mount Jumbo. We’ll plan on having two days of racing to kick off the season. Beginners and Intermediate riders will race Wednesday, Advanced riders will race Thursday. The Beginner course will stay at Marshall Mountain. Intermediate and Advanced rider should plan on leaving the campus! Intermediate and Advanced fields are limited to 49 riders each.
registration: Online registration is available through USA Cycling. Race day registration is also available, or you can save a few dollars and pick up a punch card at the Dram Shop on February 28, from 4-9pm!
notes: The Mount Jumbo Special Use Permit limits the individual events to 49 participants. Beginners will race on Wednesday, Intermediate riders will race on Thursday on the same course.
directions: Parking is available at Marshall Mountain, 5250 Marshall Canyon Road. The turn is on Hwy 200 just east of East Missoula.

title: Wednesday Night Race League #1- Intermediate
description: Parking and staging at Marshall Mountain parking area. Course will incorporate lower portions of the Marshall Mountain race course, as well as dirt roads and trails on Mount Jumbo. We’ll plan on having two days of racing to kick off the season. Beginners and Intermediate riders will race Wednesday, Advanced riders will race Thursday. The Beginner course will stay at Marshall Mountain. Intermediate and Advanced rider should plan on leaving the campus! Intermediate and Advanced fields are limited to 49 riders each.

title: Wednesday Night Race League #1 - Advanced
description: Parking and staging at Marshall Mountain parking area. Course will incorporate lower portions of the Marshall Mountain race course, as well as dirt roads and trails on Mount Jumbo. We’ll plan on having two days of racing to kick off the season. Beginners and Intermediate riders will race Wednesday, Advanced riders will race Thursday. The Beginner course will stay at Marshall Mountain. Intermediate and Advanced rider should plan on leaving the campus! Intermediate and Advanced fields are limited to 49 riders each.

title: Wednesday Night Race League #2
description: We’re bringing back cross country racing at Blue Mountain. Parking and staging will be available at the Peak Health and Wellness Center. The start/finish will be at the motorcycle trailhead. Shuttles will be available, but a quick spin up the road sounds like a great warm up to us! This event will be limited to 100 participants, and permitted by the Lolo National Forest.

title: Wednesday Night Race League #3
description: Parking and staging is available at the Snowbowl parking lot. The course will incorporate dirt road climbs and singletrack descents on snowbowl.

title: Billings Criterium Series at South Park
description: Billings Criterium Series at South Park. The Billings Criterium Series is back with FOUR great events in June and September: *** TWO Thursday Night Criteriums: 6:00 p.m. on JUNE 9th & JUNE 23rd *** MONTANA STATE CHAMPIONSHIP CRITERIUM: Satuday, June 25th at NOON *** and the Billings Omnium Weekend Criterium: 6:00 p.m. Saturday, September 24th.
course: Criterium around South Park.  Flat, smooth, four corners.

title: Wednesday Night Race League #4
description: Parking and staging available at Marshall Mountain. This is the only chance you’ll have to race on the Pro XCT course, so be sure to make it count! This is also a great opportunity for out of town racers to check out the venue before the big weekend.

title: Missoula XC presented by Zillastate
description: HC Racing at the Missoula XC. Flier to follow!

title: 12 & 24 Hours of Flathead
description: A non-profit race to provide awareness and adaptive equipment to individuals living with paralysis and other life altering disabilities
course: Roughly a 10 mile course with a combination of single track and road trails
registration: Early registration pricing is from 3/01/2015 - 8/5/2015. On 8/5/2015, registration price increases and it will increase one final time the day of the race.
notes: Winners are ranked top 3 in each category. Every winner will receive a medal.
directions: 24 Hours of Flathead is located at Herron Park in Kalispell, MT. https://plus.google.com/115746002801427229109/about?gl=us&hl=en

title: 2016 Missouri River Rampage Mountain Bike Race
Rockford Cyclocross Series
description: The Team Rockford Cyclocross Series is a weekly cyclocross training series. The runs for nine weeks from the last day of August until the end of October.
course: The course is based on a European style cyclocross course. The course layout will change each night of the series.
registration: Registration is at the course, located behind the Sunset Hills Cemetery maintenance building. Registration opens at 5:30 pm every Wednesday night. Races begin at 6 pm sharp!
notes: Series cost is $50.00, individual races cost $8.00
directions: The course is located around the field, in between the Lindley Center, and Bozeman Deaconess Hospital. Registration is behind the cemetery maintenace building, located on the north west corner of the course. All participants who are driving to the race, are instructed to park in the softball field complex parking lot, located across Highland Blvd., on the south east corner of the course.

title: Bohart Bash 2016

address.street: Bohart Ranch, 16621 Bridger Canyon Road, Bozeman, MT

description: Classic cross-country mountain bike race with food, refreshments, live music, and a terrific raffle afterward.
course: 5-mile, mostly singletrack loop that starts and ends at Bohart Ranch.
registration:
$35 for USA Cycling licensed riders
$45 for non-licensed riders
Race-day registration available
directions: At Bohart Ranch, 16 miles north of Bozeman on Highway 86, just past Bridger Bowl.

title: Montana State Time Trial Championships
description: The opening stage of the 2016 BILLINGS OMNIUM WEEKEND (3 races: TT, RR, & CRIT), this is the Montana State Championship Time Trial race.  Staging area is Canyon Creek School in at 3139 Duck Creek Road.
course: The course is 22 miles: Canyon Creek School to River Road/Thiel Road, turn around at Lance Lane, right turn up the canyon, turn around before the gravel, finish at the school.  This is the same course as last year.
notes: Pre-registration highly encouraged.  On-site registration closes 1 hour before event start.  To compete in the ROAD RACE and CRITERIUM on Saturday, you must register for those separately, but points will be awarded to each stage to determine an overall omnium winner.

title: Hogback Classic Road Race
description: The Third Annual Hogback Classic is STAGE 2 of the 2016 BILLINGS OMNIUM WEEKEND (TT on Friday night, CRIT on Saturday night).
course: Out and back course from Phipps Park staging area to Molt and back.  Each "lap" is 25 miles.  Racers will do 1, 2, or 3 laps depending upon category.
notes: Pre-registration strongly encouraged.  On-site registration closes 1 hour before event start.  In order to compete in the other stages of the omnium weekend, you must register for those events separately.
directions: Take 64th street to Molt Road.  Phipps Park is on the left just past the railroad tracks.

title: Bozeman Grand Prix
description: The Bozeman Grand Prix is the forth stop of the Wildwest Cyclocross Series. The races are open to anyone who has a U.S.A.C. licence. One day U.S.A.C. licences may also be purchased if you do not hold an annual licence. There is a category for everyone! The course is very spectator friendly, and cow bells are more than welcome! There will be music, food and refreshments available to enhance your race viewing and racing experience!
course: The course is a European style cyclocross cross course. The course will be approximately 2 miles in length with a great mixture of gravel, tarmac and dirt single track.
registration: Registration will be open online September 13th. Onsite registration opens at 9 am October 8th
notes: total prize list not to exceed $1999
directions: The race base camp is located at the Lindley Center in Bozeman. From interstate 90 get off at the Main St. Exit, #309. At the first stop light, take a left onto Highland Blvd. then take first right onto E. Curtiss Street. Stay left on E. Curtiss Street and the Lindley Center will be on your left. Overflow parking is located in the softball field parking lot just to the east of the course off Highland Blvd.
